regulation.title: Title IX Sex Discrimination and Sex-Based Harassment Complaint Procedures

issues.title: Missing Board Policy for Title IX Sex Discrimination and Sex-Based Harassment
issues.description: The district has only an Administrative Regulation (AR 4319.12) but no corresponding Board Policy (BP 4319.12). California law requires school districts to adopt board policies establishing the district's commitment to nondiscrimination and the framework for Title IX compliance. The regulation contains detailed procedures but lacks the foundational policy statements, board direction, and rights notifications that should be contained in a board policy.

legal_citations.text: It is the policy of the State of California to afford all persons in public schools, regardless of their disability, gender, gender identity, gender expression, nationality, race or ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic that is contained in the definition of hate crimes set forth in Section 422.55 of the Penal Code, equal rights and opportunities in the educational institutions of the state.

issues.required_language: The Board of Education is committed to maintaining a work and educational environment that is free from discrimination, including sexual harassment, and where all individuals are treated with dignity and respect. The district prohibits discrimination, harassment, intimidation, and bullying based on sex, including sexual harassment, in any employment practice, education program, or educational activity. The Board shall ensure prompt, thorough, and impartial investigation of complaints and shall take appropriate corrective action when discrimination is found to have occurred.

issues.title: Missing Title IX Coordinator Designation and Contact Information
issues.description: While the regulation references the Title IX Coordinator and mentions contact information is listed in AR 4119.11/4219.11/4319.11, neither the policy nor regulation actually designates who serves as the Title IX Coordinator or provides the required contact information. This is a fundamental Title IX requirement.

legal_citations.text: Each recipient must designate and authorize at least one employee to coordinate its efforts to comply with its responsibilities under this part, which employee must be referred to as the "Title IX Coordinator." The recipient must notify applicants for admission and employment, students, parents or legal guardians of elementary and secondary school students, employees, and all unions or professional organizations holding collective bargaining or professional agreements with the recipient, of the name or title, office address, electronic mail address, and telephone number of the employee or employees designated as the Title IX Coordinator.

issues.required_language: The Superintendent shall designate at least one employee to serve as the district's Title IX Coordinator. The name, title, office address, email address, and telephone number of the Title IX Coordinator shall be prominently displayed on the district website and included in district publications. Current Title IX Coordinator contact information: [Name, Title, Address, Phone, Email]

issues.title: Missing Notice of Nondiscrimination Requirements
issues.description: Neither document addresses the required public notice of nondiscrimination that must be published and distributed. This notice must inform the school community of the district's nondiscrimination policy and how to contact the Title IX Coordinator.

legal_citations.text: A recipient must prominently display the contact information required to be listed for the Title IX Coordinator under paragraph (a) of this section and the policy described in paragraph (c) of this section on its website, if any, and in each handbook or catalog that it makes available to persons entitled to a notification under paragraph (a) of this section.

issues.required_language: The district shall provide notice to students, parents/guardians, employees, applicants for admission and employment, and all unions or professional organizations holding collective bargaining agreements with the district that it does not discriminate on the basis of sex in its educational programs or activities, and that it is required by Title IX not to discriminate in such a manner. Such notification shall include the name, title, office address, email address, and telephone number of the Title IX Coordinator.

issues.title: Missing Reference to Retaliation Prohibition
issues.description: While the regulation mentions retaliation in the disciplinary actions section, there is no clear statement prohibiting retaliation against individuals who file complaints, participate in investigations, or oppose discriminatory practices as required by Title IX.

legal_citations.text: No recipient or other person may intimidate, threaten, coerce, or discriminate against any individual for the purpose of interfering with any right or privilege secured by title IX or this part, or because the individual has made a report or complaint, testified, assisted, or participated or refused to participate in any manner in an investigation, proceeding, or hearing under this part.

issues.required_language: The district prohibits retaliation against any person who files a complaint, participates in a complaint investigation, or otherwise opposes discriminatory practices prohibited by Title IX. Retaliation is itself a form of discrimination and will result in disciplinary action.
